name: Caleb Dunwell Prototypes
description:
Prototype 1 Description:

Game Overview:

This Game is based on the game snap, but you match words to images, as a image is generated a season is displayed, if the player thinks it matches: the player selects the button and the round will continue displaying another set of image and word, if the player selects incorrect the buttin will turn red and the round will continue when the timer if finished. If the player doesn’t select anything the game just continues onto the next round.

Prototype 2 Description:

Game Overview:

This game revolves around gravity, based on the concept of gravity guy they player presses on the screen and the gravity inverts, the build is also for pc in which can be played by selecting spacebar on the keyboard.

Prototype 3 Description:

Game Overview:

The concept of this game is revenge racing, like Mario kart player can interact with other players via hazards and hitboxes causing disability to players depending on the interaction. The controls are WASD as most conventional game used player controls conforming to standard industry practises.

Prototype 4 Description:

Game Overview:

The last prototype was a commission from autism QLD for nao software to be distributed to special schools, this software would be used to teach children and help the teacher in the classroom. This software came with mutable games included: number guessing game, where the student could guess higher or lower. Questionnaires for children to conduct pop quizzes in a more engaging way. And many more functions.

Install instructions

Prototype 1: This Application requires Java to be installed.

Prototype 2: Will run Standalone on Windows PC Only.

Prototype 3: Has a exe for windows and a apk for android.

Prototype 4: This prototype requires a nao robot for use. Users just open the software and uploaded it to nao.
